name: CompliLearn Builder
description: An AI‑driven compliance‑training platform that converts regulatory documents and internal policies into interactive e‑learning modules, complete with explanations, multimedia, quizzes and LMS integration for tracking employee progress.

tools.name: fetch_regulation_text
tools.description: Retrieves the full text of a regulation, standard or internal policy from a specified source given an identifier.

identifier.description: Unique ID of the document (e.g., "GDPR-Article-5" or "Policy-1234").

tools.name: extract_key_concepts
tools.description: Runs NLP over a regulation or policy text and extracts headings, definitions, obligations and actionable compliance concepts.

text.description: The full document text to analyse.

tools.name: generate_quiz
tools.description: Creates multiple‑choice questions from a list of extracted concepts. The caller can set quantity and difficulty.

concepts.description: List of concept objects extracted from the source document.

num_questions.description: Number of quiz items to generate.

tools.name: render_interactive_module
tools.description: Combines explanatory sections, optional media assets and a quiz into an HTML/SCORM package and returns a public URL.

quiz_id.description: Identifier of the quiz generated for this section.

assets.description: Optional URLs of images, videos or PDFs referenced in the body.

tools.name: store_training_record
tools.description: Saves module metadata (URL, title, version, author) into the corporate LMS and returns a unique record identifier.

module_url.description: URL where the rendered module is hosted.

tools.name: get_analytics_report
tools.description: Retrieves completion statistics for a stored module over a user‑specified date range.

examples.description: User requests a GDPR Article 5 training module; the assistant orchestrates the full pipeline and returns the live URL.

messages.content: You are CompliLearn Builder, an agentic LLM that creates compliance e‑learning modules using specialized tools.
Create a 15‑minute GDPR training covering Article 5 principles.
Sure, I’ll fetch the article, extract the key principles, build a quiz, render the module and store it for you.

Full text of GDPR Article 5:
1. Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner ... (truncated for brevity).

arguments.text:
Full text of GDPR Article 5:
1. Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner ... (truncated for brevity).

messages.content: {"concepts":[{"concept":"Lawfulness","description":"Processing must have a legal basis."},{"concept":"Fairness","description":"Processing must be fair to the data subject."},{"concept":"Transparency","description":"Data subjects must be informed about the processing."}]}
Generating a short quiz from the extracted concepts.

concepts.description: Processing must have a legal basis.
Processing must be fair to the data subject.
Data subjects must be informed about the processing.

messages.content: {"quiz_id":"quiz_1001","questions":[{"question":"Which principle requires a legal basis for processing?","options":["Lawfulness","Fairness","Transparency","Accountability"],"answer":"Lawfulness"},{"question":"What does the fairness principle protect?","options":["Data accuracy","Equitable treatment of subjects","Data minimisation","Retention limits"],"answer":"Equitable treatment of subjects"}]}
Rendering the interactive module.

sections.heading: Lawfulness
sections.body: Processing must have a legal basis such as consent, contract, or legitimate interest.

sections.heading: Fairness
sections.body: Processing must be fair to the data subject and not be misleading.

sections.heading: Transparency
sections.body: Data subjects must be provided with clear information about how their data is used.

examples.description: User asks to update an existing “Data Retention 2023” module with a new amendment and then requests a completion report for the past month.

messages.content: You are CompliLearn Builder, an agentic LLM that creates and maintains compliance training modules.
We just received an amendment to our Data Retention policy. Update the "Data Retention 2023" module with the new sections and give me a completion report for August 2025.
Understood. I will fetch the amendment, extract the new concepts, generate an additional quiz, render an updated module, store it and finally pull the analytics.

Amendment Summary:
- Retention period for customer data extended from 5 to 7 years.
- Archived logs must be destroyed after 3 years.
- New audit‑trail requirement for all data‑access events.

arguments.text:

sections.heading: Log Destruction

sections.heading: Audit Trail
